data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person does not always take 10 steps forward after facing the opposite direction of one's starting location. Even when walking backwards, you always take 10 steps forward and 10 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

It is logical to do turn around and turn right at the same point. So, the answer is yes.

When you take 9 steps left, you always go back to the position you started. When you take 10 steps left, you always take 9 steps left. When you take 3 steps left, you always take 3 steps left. When you come up from the bottom, your body is always facing towards the top. This is to prevent you from accidentally falling down and making you come back up. It is also to keep you balance and prevent you from getting injured, and the bottom is often where you’ve been standing. To return to the starting point you always take 4 steps left. To return to the starting point, always take 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.
